text: Cyclopaedia Hornwork The Weber Church of Zittau inside a hornworkEuropaeum Theatrum, Volume 5, plate 12. Published in 1651 in Frankfurt am Main. A hornwork is an element of the Italian bastion system of fortification. Its face is flanked with a pair of demi-bastions. It is distinguished from a crownwork, because crownworks contain full bastions at their centers. They are both outworks. ==References== Category:Fortifications
title: Hornwork
